snippet.title: Passengers suffer cuts and bruises after trams collide on Bourke Street
snippet.content:
Two trams have collided on Bourke Street, leaving several passengers with minor injuries. The collision happened near the intersection with Spencer Street, opposite Southern Cross station on Wednesday afternoon.Photo: Steffanie Tan An 86 tram, rear-ended a 96 tram. A number of passengers have suffered cuts and bruises. Ambulance Victoria say they are assessing about "15 people at this stage". The 96 and 86 trams are being diverted, with the section of Bourke Street, between Spencer and King, having been closed by police.
More to come
